          <div data-target="readme-toc.content" class="Box-body px-5 pb-5">
            <article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-htmlproofer" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#htmlproofer"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>HTMLProofer</h1>
<p dir="auto">If you generate HTML files, <em>then this tool might be for you</em>!</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-project-scope" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#project-scope"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Project scope</h2>
<p dir="auto">HTMLProofer is a set of tests to validate your HTML output. These tests check if your image references are legitimate, if they have alt tags, if your internal links are working, and so on. It's intended to be an all-in-one checker for your output.</p>
<p dir="auto">In scope for this project is any well-known and widely-used test for HTML document quality. A major use for this project is continuous integration -- so we must have reliable results. We usually balance correctness over performance. And, if necessary, we should be able to trace this program's detection of HTML errors back to documented best practices or standards, such as W3 specifications.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Third-party modules.</strong> We want this product to be useful for continuous integration so we prefer to avoid subjective tests which are prone to false positive results, such as spell checkers, indentation checkers, etc. If you want to work on these items, please see <a href="#custom-tests">the section on custom tests</a> and consider adding an implementation as a third-party module.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Advanced configuration.</strong> Most front-end developers can test their HTML using <a href="#using-on-the-command-line">our command line program</a>. Advanced configuration will require using Ruby.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Installation</h2>
<p dir="auto">Add this line to your application's Gemfile:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="gem 'html-proofer'"><pre class="notranslate"><code>gem 'html-proofer'
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">And then execute:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ bundle install"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ bundle install
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Or install it yourself as:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ gem install html-proofer"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ gem install html-proofer
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>NOTE:</strong> When installation speed matters, set <code>NOKOGIRI_USE_SYSTEM_LIBRARIES</code> to <code>true</code> in your environment. This is useful for increasing the speed of your Continuous Integration builds.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-whats-tested" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#whats-tested"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>What's tested?</h2>
<p dir="auto">Below is a mostly comprehensive list of checks that HTMLProofer can perform.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-images" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#images"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Images</h3>
<p dir="auto"><code>img</code> elements:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Whether all your images have alt tags</li>
<li>Whether your internal image references are not broken</li>
<li>Whether external images are showing</li>
<li>Whether your images are HTTP</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-links" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#links"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Links</h3>
<p dir="auto"><code>a</code>, <code>link</code> elements:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Whether your internal links are working</li>
<li>Whether your internal hash references (<code>#linkToMe</code>) are working</li>
<li>Whether external links are working</li>
<li>Whether your links are HTTPS</li>
<li>Whether CORS/SRI is enabled</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-scripts" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#scripts"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Scripts</h3>
<p dir="auto"><code>script</code> elements:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Whether your internal script references are working</li>
<li>Whether external scripts are loading</li>
<li>Whether CORS/SRI is enabled</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-favicon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#favicon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Favicon</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Whether your favicons are valid.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-opengraph" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#opengraph"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>OpenGraph</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Whether the images and URLs in the OpenGraph metadata are valid.</li>
</ul>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Usage</h2>
<p dir="auto">You can configure HTMLProofer to run on:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>a file</li>
<li>a directory</li>
<li>an array of directories</li>
<li>an array of links</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">It can also run through the command-line.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-using-in-a-script" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#using-in-a-script"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Using in a script</h3>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Require the gem.</li>
<li>Generate some HTML.</li>
<li>Create a new instance of the <code>HTMLProofer</code> on your output folder.</li>
<li>Call <code>proofer.run</code> on that path.</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto">Here's an example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require 'html-proofer'
require 'html/pipeline'
require 'find'

# make an out dir
Dir.mkdir("out") unless File.exist?("out")

pipeline = HTML::Pipeline.new [
  HTML::Pipeline::MarkdownFilter,
  HTML::Pipeline::TableOfContentsFilter
], gfm: true

# iterate over files, and generate HTML from Markdown
Find.find("./docs") do |path|
  if File.extname(path) == ".md"
    contents = File.read(path)
    result = pipeline.call(contents)

    File.open("out/#{path.split("/").pop.sub('.md', '.html')}", 'w') { |file| file.write(result[:output].to_s) }
  end
end

# test your out dir!
HTMLProofer.check_directory("./out").run"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">'html-proofer'</span>
<span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">'html/pipeline'</span>
<span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">'find'</span>

<span class="pl-c"># make an out dir</span>
<span class="pl-v">Dir</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">mkdir</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">unless</span> <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">exist?</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-s1">pipeline</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">HTML</span>::<span class="pl-v">Pipeline</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span> <span class="pl-kos">[</span>
  <span class="pl-c1">HTML</span>::<span class="pl-v">Pipeline</span>::<span class="pl-v">MarkdownFilter</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-c1">HTML</span>::<span class="pl-v">Pipeline</span>::<span class="pl-v">TableOfContentsFilter</span>
<span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">gfm</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span>

<span class="pl-c"># iterate over files, and generate HTML from Markdown</span>
<span class="pl-v">Find</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">find</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"./docs"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">path</span>|
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">extname</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> == <span class="pl-s">".md"</span>
    <span class="pl-s1">contents</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">read</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
    <span class="pl-s1">result</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">pipeline</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">call</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">contents</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

    <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">open</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out/<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-kos">#{</span><span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">split</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"/"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">pop</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">sub</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'.md'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'.html'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></span>"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'w'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> |<span class="pl-s1">file</span>| <span class="pl-s1">file</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">write</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">result</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-pds">:output</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">to_s</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>

<span class="pl-c"># test your out dir!</span>
<span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"./out"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-checking-a-single-file" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#checking-a-single-file"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Checking a single file</h3>
<p dir="auto">If you simply want to check a single file, use the <code>check_file</code> method:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_file('/path/to/a/file.html').run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_file</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'/path/to/a/file.html'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-checking-directories" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#checking-directories"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Checking directories</h3>
<p dir="auto">If you want to check a directory, use <code>check_directory</code>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directory('./out').run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'./out'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">If you want to check multiple directories, use <code>check_directories</code>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directories(['./one', './two']).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directories</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'./one'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'./two'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-checking-an-array-of-links" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#checking-an-array-of-links"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Checking an array of links</h3>
<p dir="auto">With <code>check_links</code>, you can also pass in an array of links:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_links(['https://github.com', 'https://jekyllrb.com']).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_links</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'https://github.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'https://jekyllrb.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-swapping-information" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#swapping-information"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Swapping information</h3>
<p dir="auto">Sometimes, the information in your HTML is not the same as how your server serves content. In these cases, you can use <code>swap_urls</code> to map the URL in a file to the URL you'd like it to become. For example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="run_proofer(file, :file, swap_urls: { %r{^https//example.com}: 'https://website.com' })"><pre><span class="pl-en">run_proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">file</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">:file</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">swap_urls</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">%r{^https//example.com}</span>: <span class="pl-s">'https://website.com'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">In this case, any link that matches the <code>^https://example.com</code> will be converted to <code>https://website.com</code>.</p>
<p dir="auto">A similar swapping process can be done for attributes:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="run_proofer(file, :file, swap_urls: { 'img': [['src', 'srcset']] })"><pre><span class="pl-en">run_proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">file</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">:file</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">swap_urls</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-s">'img'</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'src'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'srcset'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">In this case, we are telling HTMLProofer that, for any <code>img</code> tag detected, and for any check using the <code>src</code> attribute, to use the <code>srcset</code> attribute instead. Since the value is an array of arrays, you can pass in as many attribute swaps as you need.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-using-on-the-command-line" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#using-on-the-command-line"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Using on the command-line</h3>
<p dir="auto">You'll also get a new program called <code>htmlproofer</code> with this gem. Terrific!</p>
<p dir="auto">Pass in options through the command-line as flags, like this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --extensions .html.erb ./out"><pre>htmlproofer --extensions .html.erb ./out</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Use <code>htmlproofer --help</code> to see all command line options, or <a href="https://github.com/gjtorikian/html-proofer/blob/main/bin/htmlproofer">take a peek here</a>.</p>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-special-cases-for-the-command-line" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#special-cases-for-the-command-line"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Special cases for the command-line</h4>
<p dir="auto">For options which require an array of input, surround the value with quotes, and don't use
any spaces. For example, to exclude an array of HTTP status code, you might do:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --ignore-status-codes "999,401,404" ./out"><pre>htmlproofer --ignore-status-codes <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>999,401,404<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> ./out</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">For something like <code>url-ignore</code>, and other options that require an array of regular expressions,
you can pass in a syntax like this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --ignore-urls "/www.github.com/,/foo.com/" ./out"><pre>htmlproofer --ignore-urls <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>/www.github.com/,/foo.com/<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> ./out</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Since <code>swap_urls</code> is a bit special, you'll pass in a pair of <code>RegEx:String</code>
values. The escape sequences <code>\:</code> should be used to produce literal
<code>:</code>s <code>htmlproofer</code> will figure out what you mean.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --swap-urls "wow:cow,mow:doh" --extensions .html.erb --ignore-urls www.github.com ./out"><pre>htmlproofer --swap-urls <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>wow:cow,mow:doh<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> --extensions .html.erb --ignore-urls www.github.com ./out</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Some configuration options--such as <code>--typheous</code>, <code>--cache</code>, or <code>--attribute-swap</code>--require well-formatted JSON.</p>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-adjusting-for-a-baseurl" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#adjusting-for-a-baseurl"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Adjusting for a <code>baseurl</code></h4>
<p dir="auto">If your Jekyll site has a <code>baseurl</code> configured, you'll need to adjust the
generated url validation to cope with that. The easiest way is using the
<code>swap_urls</code> option.</p>
<p dir="auto">For a <code>site.baseurl</code> value of <code>/BASEURL</code>, here's what that looks like on the
command line:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --assume-extension ./_site --swap-urls '^/BASEURL/:/'"><pre>htmlproofer --assume-extension ./_site --swap-urls <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>^/BASEURL/:/<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">or in your <code>Rakefile</code></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require 'html-proofer'

task :test do
  sh "bundle exec jekyll build"
  options = { swap_urls: "^/BASEURL/:/" }
  HTMLProofer.check_directory("./_site", options).run
end"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">'html-proofer'</span>

<span class="pl-en">task</span> <span class="pl-pds">:test</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
  <span class="pl-en">sh</span> <span class="pl-s">"bundle exec jekyll build"</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">options</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">swap_urls</span>: <span class="pl-s">"^/BASEURL/:/"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
  <span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"./_site"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-using-through-docker" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#using-through-docker"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Using through Docker</h3>
<p dir="auto">If you have trouble with (or don't want to) install Ruby/Nokogumbo, the command-line tool can be run through Docker. See <a href="https://hub.docker.com/r/klakegg/html-proofer" rel="nofollow">klakegg/html-proofer</a> for more information.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-ignoring-content" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#ignoring-content"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Ignoring content</h2>
<p dir="auto">Add the <code>data-proofer-ignore</code> attribute to any tag to ignore it from every check.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<a href="https://notareallink" data-proofer-ignore>Not checked.</a>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">a</span> <span class="pl-c1">href</span>="<span class="pl-s">https://notareallink</span>" <span class="pl-c1">data-proofer-ignore</span><span class="pl-kos">></span>Not checked.<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">a</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This can also apply to parent elements, all the way up to the <code><html></code> tag:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<div data-proofer-ignore>
  <a href="https://notareallink">Not checked because of parent.</a>
</div>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">div</span> <span class="pl-c1">data-proofer-ignore</span><span class="pl-kos">></span>
  <span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">a</span> <span class="pl-c1">href</span>="<span class="pl-s">https://notareallink</span>"<span class="pl-kos">></span>Not checked because of parent.<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">a</span><span class="pl-kos">></span>
<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">div</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-ignoring-new-files" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#ignoring-new-files"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Ignoring new files</h2>
<p dir="auto">Say you've got some new files in a pull request, and your tests are failing because links to those files are not live yet. One thing you can do is run a diff against your base branch and explicitly ignore the new files, like this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="  directories = %w(content)
  merge_base = `git merge-base origin/production HEAD`.chomp
  diffable_files = `git diff -z --name-only --diff-filter=AC #{merge_base}`.split("\0")
  diffable_files = diffable_files.select do |filename|
    next true if directories.include?(File.dirname(filename))
    filename.end_with?('.md')
  end.map { |f| Regexp.new(File.basename(f, File.extname(f))) }

  HTMLProofer.check_directory('./output', { ignore_urls: diffable_files }).run"><pre>  <span class="pl-s1">directories</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">%w(</span><span class="pl-s">content</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">merge_base</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">`git merge-base origin/production HEAD`</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">chomp</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">diffable_files</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">`git diff -z --name-only --diff-filter=AC <span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-kos">#{</span><span class="pl-s1">merge_base</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></span>`</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">split</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"<span class="pl-cce">\0</span>"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">diffable_files</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">diffable_files</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">select</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">filename</span>|
    <span class="pl-k">next</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">directories</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">include?</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">dirname</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">filename</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
    <span class="pl-s1">filename</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">end_with?</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'.md'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">map</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> |<span class="pl-s1">f</span>| <span class="pl-v">Regexp</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">basename</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">f</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">extname</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">f</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>

  <span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'./output'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">ignore_urls</span>: <span class="pl-s1">diffable_files</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-configuration" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#configuration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Configuration</h2>
<p dir="auto">The <code>HTMLProofer</code> constructor takes an optional hash of additional options:</p>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th align="left">Option</th>
<th align="left">Description</th>
<th align="left">Default</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>allow_hash_href</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, assumes <code>href="#"</code> anchors are valid</td>
<td align="left"><code>true</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>allow_missing_href</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, does not flag <code>a</code> tags missing <code>href</code>. In HTML5, this is technically allowed, but could also be human error.</td>
<td align="left"><code>false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>assume_extension</code></td>
<td align="left">Automatically add specified extension to files for internal links, to allow extensionless URLs (as supported by most servers)</td>
<td align="left"><code>.html</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>checks</code></td>
<td align="left">An array of Strings indicating which checks you want to run</td>
<td align="left"><code>['Links', 'Images', 'Scripts']</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>check_external_hash</code></td>
<td align="left">Checks whether external hashes exist (even if the webpage exists)</td>
<td align="left"><code>true</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>check_internal_hash</code></td>
<td align="left">Checks whether internal hashes exist (even if the webpage exists)</td>
<td align="left"><code>true</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>check_sri</code></td>
<td align="left">Check that <code><link></code> and <code><script></code> external resources use SRI</td>
<td align="left">false</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>directory_index_file</code></td>
<td align="left">Sets the file to look for when a link refers to a directory.</td>
<td align="left"><code>index.html</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>disable_external</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, does not run the external link checker</td>
<td align="left"><code>false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>enforce_https</code></td>
<td align="left">Fails a link if it's not marked as <code>https</code>.</td>
<td align="left"><code>true</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>extensions</code></td>
<td align="left">An array of Strings indicating the file extensions you would like to check (including the dot)</td>
<td align="left"><code>['.html']</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_empty_alt</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, ignores images with empty/missing alt tags (in other words, <code><img alt></code> and <code><img alt=""></code> are valid; set this to <code>false</code> to flag those)</td>
<td align="left"><code>true</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_files</code></td>
<td align="left">An array of Strings or RegExps containing file paths that are safe to ignore.</td>
<td align="left"><code>[]</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_empty_mailto</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, allows <code>mailto:</code> <code>href</code>s which do not contain an email address.</td>
<td align="left"><code>false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_missing_alt</code></td>
<td align="left">If <code>true</code>, ignores images with missing alt tags</td>
<td align="left"><code>false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_status_codes</code></td>
<td align="left">An array of numbers representing status codes to ignore.</td>
<td align="left"><code>[]</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>ignore_urls</code></td>
<td align="left">An array of Strings or RegExps containing URLs that are safe to ignore. This affects all HTML attributes, such as <code>alt</code> tags on images.</td>
<td align="left"><code>[]</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>log_level</code></td>
<td align="left">Sets the logging level, as determined by <a href="https://github.com/rudionrails/yell">Yell</a>. One of <code>:debug</code>, <code>:info</code>, <code>:warn</code>, <code>:error</code>, or <code>:fatal</code>.</td>
<td align="left"><code>:info</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>only_4xx</code></td>
<td align="left">Only reports errors for links that fall within the 4xx status code range.</td>
<td align="left"><code>false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>root_dir</code></td>
<td align="left">The absolute path to the directory serving your html-files.</td>
<td align="left">""</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>swap_attributes</code></td>
<td align="left">JSON-formatted config that maps element names to the preferred attribute to check</td>
<td align="left"><code>{}</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="left"><code>swap_urls</code></td>
<td align="left">A hash containing key-value pairs of <code>RegExp => String</code>. It transforms URLs that match <code>RegExp</code> into <code>String</code> via <code>gsub</code>.</td>
<td align="left"><code>{}</code></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p dir="auto">In addition, there are a few "namespaced" options. These are:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><code>:typhoeus</code> / <code>:hydra</code></li>
<li><code>:parallel</code></li>
<li><code>:cache</code></li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-configuring-typhoeus-and-hydra" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#configuring-typhoeus-and-hydra"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Configuring Typhoeus and Hydra</h3>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus">Typhoeus</a> is used to make fast, parallel requests to external URLs. You can pass in any of Typhoeus' options for the external link checks with the options namespace of <code>:typhoeus</code>. For example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.new("out/", {extensions: [".htm"], typhoeus: { verbose: true, ssl_verifyhost: 2 } })"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">extensions</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">".htm"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">typhoeus</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">verbose</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifyhost</span>: <span class="pl-c1">2</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This sets <code>HTMLProofer</code>'s extensions to use <em>.htm</em>, gives Typhoeus a configuration for it to be verbose, and use specific SSL settings. Check the <a href="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus#other-curl-options">Typhoeus documentation</a> for more information on what options it can receive.</p>
<p dir="auto">You can similarly pass in a <code>:hydra</code> option with a hash configuration for Hydra.</p>
<p dir="auto">The default value is:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{
  typhoeus:
  {
    followlocation: true,
    connecttimeout: 10,
    timeout: 30
  },
  hydra: { max_concurrency: 50 }
}"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">typhoeus</span>:
  <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">connecttimeout</span>: <span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">timeout</span>: <span class="pl-c1">30</span>
  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">hydra</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">max_concurrency</span>: <span class="pl-c1">50</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">On the CLI, you can provide the <code>--typhoeus</code> or <code>hydra</code> arguments to set the configurations. This is parsed using <code>JSON.parse</code> and mapped on top of the default configuration values so that they can be overridden.</p>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-setting-before-request-callback" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#setting-before-request-callback"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Setting <code>before-request</code> callback</h4>
<p dir="auto">You can provide a block to set some logic before an external link is checked. For example, say you want to provide an authentication token every time a GitHub URL is checked. You can do that like this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="proofer = HTMLProofer.check_directory(item, opts)
proofer.before_request do |request|
  request.options[:headers]['Authorization'] = "Bearer <TOKEN>" if request.base_url == "https://github.com"
end
proofer.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">proofer</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">item</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">opts</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">before_request</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">request</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">options</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-pds">:headers</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'Authorization'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">"Bearer <TOKEN>"</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">base_url</span> == <span class="pl-s">"https://github.com"</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The <code>Authorization</code> header is being set if and only if the <code>base_url</code> is <code>https://github.com</code>, and it is excluded for all other URLs.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-configuring-parallel" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#configuring-parallel"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Configuring Parallel</h3>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/grosser/parallel">Parallel</a> is used to speed internal file checks. You can pass in any of its options with the options namespace <code>:parallel</code>. For example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directories(["out/"], {extension: ".htm", parallel: { in_processes: 3} })"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directories</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">extension</span>: <span class="pl-s">".htm"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">parallel</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">in_processes</span>: <span class="pl-c1">3</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">In this example, <code>in_processes: 3</code> is passed into Parallel as a configuration option.</p>
<p dir="auto">Pass in <code>parallel: { enable: false }</code> to disable parallel runs.</p>
<p dir="auto">On the CLI, you can provide the <code>--parallel</code> argument to set the configuration. This is parsed using <code>JSON.parse</code> and mapped on top of the default configuration values so that they can be overridden.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-configuring-caching" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#configuring-caching"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Configuring caching</h2>
<p dir="auto">Checking external URLs can slow your tests down. If you'd like to speed that up, you can enable caching for your external and internal links. Caching simply means to skip link checking for links that are valid for a certain period of time.</p>
<p dir="auto">You can enable caching for this by passing in the configuration option <code>:cache</code>, with a hash containing a single key, <code>:timeframe</code>. <code>:timeframe</code> defines the length of time the cache will be used before the link is checked again. The format of <code>:timeframe</code> is a hash containing two keys, <code>external</code> and <code>internal</code>. Each of these contains a number followed by a letter indicating the length of time:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><code>M</code> means months</li>
<li><code>w</code> means weeks</li>
<li><code>d</code> means days</li>
<li><code>h</code> means hours</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">For example, passing the following options means "recheck external links older than thirty days":</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{ cache: { timeframe: { external: '30d' } } }"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">timeframe</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">external</span>: <span class="pl-s">'30d'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">And the following options means "recheck internal links older than two weeks":</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{ cache: { timeframe: { internal: '2w' } } }"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">timeframe</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">internal</span>: <span class="pl-s">'2w'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Naturally, to support both internal and external link caching, both keys would need to be provided. The following checks external links every two weeks, but internal links only once a week:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{ cache: { timeframe: { external: '2w', internal: '1w' } } }"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">timeframe</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">external</span>: <span class="pl-s">'2w'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">internal</span>: <span class="pl-s">'1w'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">You can change the filename or the directory where the cache file is kept by also providing the <code>storage_dir</code> key:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{ cache: { cache_file: 'stay_cachey.json', storage_dir: '/tmp/html-proofer-cache-money' } }"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache_file</span>: <span class="pl-s">'stay_cachey.json'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">storage_dir</span>: <span class="pl-s">'/tmp/html-proofer-cache-money'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Links that were failures are kept in the cache and <em>always</em> rechecked. If they pass, the cache is updated to note the new timestamp.</p>
<p dir="auto">The cache operates on external links only.</p>
<p dir="auto">If caching is enabled, HTMLProofer writes to a log file called <em>tmp/.htmlproofer/cache.log</em>. You should probably ignore this folder in your version control system.</p>
<p dir="auto">On the CLI, you can provide the <code>--cache</code> argument to set the configuration. This is parsed using <code>JSON.parse</code> and mapped on top of the default configuration values so that they can be overridden.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-caching-with-continuous-integration" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#caching-with-continuous-integration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Caching with continuous integration</h3>
<p dir="auto">Enable caching in your continuous integration process. It will make your builds faster.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>In GitHub Actions:</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">Add this step to your build workflow before HTMLProofer is run:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-yaml notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="      - name: Cache HTMLProofer
        id: cache-htmlproofer
        uses: actions/cache@v2
        with:
          path: tmp/.htmlproofer
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-htmlproofer"><pre>      - <span class="pl-ent">name</span>: <span class="pl-s">Cache HTMLProofer</span>
        <span class="pl-ent">id</span>: <span class="pl-s">cache-htmlproofer</span>
        <span class="pl-ent">uses</span>: <span class="pl-s">actions/cache@v2</span>
        <span class="pl-ent">with</span>:
          <span class="pl-ent">path</span>: <span class="pl-s">tmp/.htmlproofer</span>
          <span class="pl-ent">key</span>: <span class="pl-s">${{ runner.os }}-htmlproofer</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Also make sure that your later step which runs HTMLProofer will not return a failed shell status. You can try something like <code>html-proof ... || true</code>. Because a failed step in GitHub Actions will skip all later steps.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>In Travis:</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">If you want to enable caching with Travis CI, be sure to add these lines into your <em>.travis.yml</em> file:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-yaml notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="cache:
  directories:
  - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/tmp/.htmlproofer"><pre><span class="pl-ent">cache</span>:
  <span class="pl-ent">directories</span>:
  - <span class="pl-s">$TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/tmp/.htmlproofer</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">For more information on using HTML-Proofer with Travis CI, see <a href="https://github.com/gjtorikian/html-proofer/wiki/Using-HTMLProofer-From-Ruby-and-Travis">this wiki page</a>.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-logging" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#logging"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Logging</h2>
<p dir="auto">HTML-Proofer can be as noisy or as quiet as you'd like. If you set the <code>:log_level</code> option, you can better define the level of logging.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-custom-tests" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#custom-tests"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Custom tests</h2>
<p dir="auto">Want to write your own test? Sure, that's possible!</p>
<p dir="auto">Just create a class that inherits from <code>HTMLProofer::Check</code>. This subclass must define one method called <code>run</code>. This is called on your content, and is responsible for performing the validation on whatever elements you like. When you catch a broken issue, call <code>add_failure(message, line: line, content: content)</code> to explain the error. <code>line</code> refers to the line numbers, and <code>content</code> is the node content of the broken element.</p>
<p dir="auto">If you're working with the element's attributes (as most checks do), you'll also want to call <code>create_element(node)</code> as part of your suite. This constructs an object that contains all the attributes of the HTML element you're iterating on.</p>
<p dir="auto">Here's an example custom test demonstrating these concepts. It reports <code>mailto</code> links that point to <code>octocat@github.com</code>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="class MailToOctocat < ::HTMLProofer::Check
  def mailto_octocat?
    @link.url.raw_attribute == 'mailto:octocat@github.com'
  end

  def run
    @html.css('a').each do |node|
      @link = create_element(node)

      next if @link.ignore?

      return add_failure("Don't email the Octocat directly!", line: @link.line) if mailto_octocat?
    end
  end
end"><pre><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">MailToOctocat</span> < ::<span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span>::<span class="pl-v">Check</span>
  <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">mailto_octocat?</span>
    <span class="pl-c1">@link</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">url</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">raw_attribute</span> == <span class="pl-s">'mailto:octocat@github.com'</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>

  <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">run</span>
    <span class="pl-c1">@html</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">css</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'a'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">each</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">node</span>|
      <span class="pl-c1">@link</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">create_element</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">node</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

      <span class="pl-k">next</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-c1">@link</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">ignore?</span>

      <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-en">add_failure</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"Don't email the Octocat directly!"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">line</span>: <span class="pl-c1">@link</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">line</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-en">mailto_octocat?</span>
    <span class="pl-k">end</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Don't forget to include this new check in HTMLProofer's options, for example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# removes default checks and just runs this one
HTMLProofer.check_directories(["out/"], {checks: ['MailToOctocat']})"><pre><span class="pl-c"># removes default checks and just runs this one</span>
<span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directories</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">checks</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'MailToOctocat'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">See our <a href="https://github.com/gjtorikian/html-proofer/wiki/Extensions-(custom-classes)">list of third-party custom classes</a> and add your own to this list.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-reporting" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#reporting"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Reporting</h2>
<p dir="auto">By default, HTML-Proofer has its own reporting mechanism to print errors at the end of the run. You can choose to use your own reporter by passing in your own subclass of <code>HTMLProofer::Reporter</code>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="proofer = HTMLProofer.check_directory(item, opts)
proofer.reporter = MyCustomReporter.new(logger: proofer.logger)
proofer.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">proofer</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">item</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">opts</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">reporter</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">MyCustomReporter</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">logger</span>: <span class="pl-s1">proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">logger</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">proofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Your custom reporter must implement the <code>report</code> function which implements the behavior you wish to see. The <code>logger</code> kwarg is optional.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-troubleshooting" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#troubleshooting"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Troubleshooting</h2>
<p dir="auto">Here are some brief snippets identifying some common problems that you can work around. For more information, check out <a href="https://github.com/gjtorikian/html-proofer/wiki">our wiki</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/gjtorikian/html-proofer/wiki/Using-HTMLProofer-From-Ruby-and-Travis">Our wiki page</a> on using HTML-Proofer with Travis CI might also be useful.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-ignoring-ssl-certificates" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#ignoring-ssl-certificates"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Ignoring SSL certificates</h3>
<p dir="auto">To ignore SSL certificates, turn off Typhoeus' SSL verification:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directory("out/", {
  typhoeus: {
    ssl_verifypeer: false,
    ssl_verifyhost: 0}
}).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">typhoeus</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifypeer</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifyhost</span>: <span class="pl-c1">0</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-user-agent" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#user-agent"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>User-Agent</h3>
<p dir="auto">To change the User-Agent used by Typhoeus:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directory("out/", {
  typhoeus: {
    headers: { "User-Agent" => "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; My New User-Agent)" }
}}).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">typhoeus</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">headers</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-s">"User-Agent"</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-s">"Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; My New User-Agent)"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Alternatively, you can specifify these options on the commandline with:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --typhoeus-config='{"headers":{"User-Agent":"Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; My New User-Agent)"}}'"><pre>htmlproofer --typhoeus-config=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>{"headers":{"User-Agent":"Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; My New User-Agent)"}}<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-cookies" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#cookies"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Cookies</h3>
<p dir="auto">Sometimes links fail because they don't have access to cookies. To fix this you can create a .cookies file using the following snippets:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directory("out/", {
  typhoeus: {
    cookiefile: ".cookies",
    cookiejar: ".cookies"
}}).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directory</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">typhoeus</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">cookiefile</span>: <span class="pl-s">".cookies"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">cookiejar</span>: <span class="pl-s">".cookies"</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="htmlproofer --typhoeus-config='{"cookiefile":".cookies","cookiejar":".cookies"}'"><pre>htmlproofer --typhoeus-config=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>{"cookiefile":".cookies","cookiejar":".cookies"}<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-regular-expressions" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#regular-expressions"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Regular expressions</h3>
<p dir="auto">To exclude urls using regular expressions, include them between forward slashes and don't quote them:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTMLProofer.check_directories(["out/"], {
  ignore_urls: [/example.com/],
}).run"><pre><span class="pl-v">HTMLProofer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">check_directories</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"out/"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">ignore_urls</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-pds">/example.com/</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-real-life-examples" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#real-life-examples"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Real-life examples</h2>

  <h3 class="sr-only">Code of conduct</h3>
  <div class="mt-2">
    <a href="/gjtorikian/html-proofer/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md"
      class="Link--muted"
      
      data-analytics-event="{"category":"Repository Overview","action":"click","label":"location:sidebar;file:code of conduct"}"
